channel.title: Rob Janoff on Logotyp.us

item.title: Apple
item.description: History of Apple logo At the time of his initial meeting with Steve Jobs in early 1977, Apple Computer was still very much in its infancy, having been incorporated for less than a year. Apple’s offices were in a local strip mall, and consisted of just the three partners – Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak and Mike Markkula. The initial identity development was to coincide with the introduction of the brand’s first personal computer, the Apple II.
